title.romaji: Aoki Hagane no Arpeggio: Ars Nova

description:
In the story, a Fleet of Fog loaded with super weapons suddenly appear all over the world. Without the ability to withstand this fleet, humanity was defeated and could no longer travel the seas. 17 years after the devastating naval war, Chihaya Gunzou and his friends somehow commandeer a Fleet of Fog submarine and rename it I-401. Together with Iona, they take on the Fleet of Fog.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Full CGI
tags.description: Almost entirely created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Ships
tags.description: Prominently features the use of sea-based transportation vessels.

tags.name: Post-Apocalyptic
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a world or civilization after a global disaster.

tags.name: Dystopian
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a society characterized by poverty, squalor or oppression.

tags.name: Artificial Intelligence
tags.description: Intelligent non-organic machines that work and react similarly to humans.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Fugitive
tags.description: Prominently features a character evading capture by an individual or organization.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

title.native: 劇場版 蒼き鋼のアルペジオ -アルス・ノヴァ-  DC
劇場版 蒼き鋼のアルペジオ -アルス・ノヴァ- Cadenza

node.description: Studio composed of Kenji Mitsuyoshi and Koichi Ishikawa.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/995498317)

Interested in films and comics from his early childhood on. After graduating high school he went to Yoyogi Animation Gakuin and afterwards started working as animator for [Ajia-do](https://anilist.co/studio/30/). After becoming a freelancer for a short time, he joined Logistics where he worked in the software development section and was responsible for animation work and later developing tools for animation work in games. In 2002 he founded [Team Till Dawn](https://anilist.co/studio/6412/), which was also the beginning of his career as anime director.

His hobbies outside of work include bodybuilding, in which he has gone as far as to take part in competitions

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mtocoda/)

He worked as a music composer for Capcom after graduating from the Kunitachi College of Music. He left the company in 2003 and founded Design Wave in 2007, and is still working as a composer for video games.  He is known for his work on the Devil May Cry and Monster Hunter series.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/93473950)

Worked as an assistant to [Shirou Oono](https://anilist.co/staff/132305/) in the late '90s.

name.native: マイファーストストーリ

node.description:
A Japanese rock band from Shibuya, Tokyo. Formed in 2011, the band currently consists of vocalist Hiroki Moriuchi, guitarist Teruki Nishizawa, bassist Nobuaki Katou, and drummer Shouhei Sasaki.

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Official Website](https://nanonano.me/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/nanonano_me?s=20&t=4VTA1umvQXVSsyul5mYvQg) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/officialnanoTV) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/nanonano_me/?hl=ja)


nano is a female singer/song writer on NicoNicoDouga who covers Vocaloid and non-Vocaloid songs in Japanese and English. She has participated in many translations and collaborations because of fluency. nano moved back to Japan during middle school. This is where the “帰国子女” in one of his or her video titles comes from. Kikokushijo means “one who has returned to their homeland”.
